core:action.core:comment: We chain these tests so that we can explicitly determine the order of priority of the events (otherwise it's down to the order they appear in the XML). Put the cashdrawer open test first?

core:assignAction.core:comment: Set the HandledEvent flag to prevent StateEntered from immediately sending us back where we came from.
Clear the HandledEvent flag to allow some statuses to be checked on StateEntered.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: No printer status messages if no user signed on.

core:dataAssignment.fromExpression: iCCReader != null && iCCReader.config != null && ! (iCCReader.config.connectOnSignOn || iCCReader.config.connectInTransaction || iCCReader.config.connectInTendering)

core:eventLink.core:comment: Make sure we always connect on tendering started, just in case

core:messageState.core:comment: Get here when the cashdrawer is open (unexpectedly) and a user is signed on. He may be able to continue if he has or gets authorisation.

core:promptState.core:comment: Get here when Cashdrawer is open but user is not signed on. We must allow OK to dismiss the message so that the user gets a chance to sign on. Once signed on he will not be able to continue without closing the drawer unless he has or gets authority to continue with the cashdrawer open. If he doesn't sign on quickly, he will be back here again when another CashdrawerStatus event is raised by the cashdrawer open warning timer.

core:messageState.core:comment: Get here when Cashdrawer is open but user is not signed on. We must allow OK to dismiss the message so that the user gets a chance to sign on. Once signed on he will not be able to continue without closing the drawer unless he has or gets authority to continue with the cashdrawer open. If he doesn't sign on quickly, he will be back here again when another CashdrawerStatus event is raised by the cashdrawer open warning timer.

Get here when Cashdrawer is open and user is signed on but user does not have privilege to continue with drawer open. We don't currently go to the authorising user stage to get the privilege because this is not safe to use from the background - it would need to be specially written to work here.
